Sentencas: The performance of solid oxide cells (SOCs) heavily relies on the population of three-phase boundaries (TPBs) in the composite electrodes.
Titulo: Design and Optimization of Composite Electrodes in Solid Oxide Cells

Sentencas: In this study, SOC composite electrodes are described by percolating binary particle aggregates that are constructed from random loose packing models and classical sintering theories.
Titulo: Design and Optimization of Composite Electrodes in Solid Oxide Cells

Sentencas: Summed perimeters of the sintering necks represent the total TPB lengths.
Titulo: Design and Optimization of Composite Electrodes in Solid Oxide Cells

Sentencas: A case study has been carried out on lanthanum strontium manganite (LSM)yttria-stabilized zirconia (YSZ) composite electrodes.
Titulo: Design and Optimization of Composite Electrodes in Solid Oxide Cells

Sentencas: By employing three-dimensional data that are converted from relevant two-dimensional data, the TPB length of baseline LSMYSZ electrodes investigated in this study is 35.4 mu m mu m3.
Titulo: Design and Optimization of Composite Electrodes in Solid Oxide Cells

Sentencas: The parametric and sensitivity analyses show the changes of TPB lengths in functions of the weight fraction of powders, particle size and particle size ratio of powders, void fraction of electrodes, and density of materials.
Titulo: Design and Optimization of Composite Electrodes in Solid Oxide Cells

Sentencas: In the case of baseline LSMYSZ electrodes, proper electrode design and optimization would result in 23 times of the enlargement of TPBs.
Titulo: Design and Optimization of Composite Electrodes in Solid Oxide Cells

Sentencas: Technical guidelines on the design and optimization of SOC composite electrodes are proposed.
Titulo: Design and Optimization of Composite Electrodes in Solid Oxide Cells
